result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad W Myers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED. Costs paid in full.
DNA surcharge is WAIVED.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No violent contact with GMS.
Attend Anger Management and Domestic violence Counseling.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time (nonworking) STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion, as well as to the huber or straight time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad W Myers

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Chad W Myers in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Melissa Zilavy and  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 3. Defense to calculate and submit credit in writing to the court. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 3:
- 6 months jail straight time STAYED for 1 year Probation
- Court Costs of $243.00 - apply bail and refund balance 
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent.  No violent contact with GMS. Domestic Violence Counseling. Anger Management.  
- Defendant to perform 75 hours of community service as a Condition of Probation.
- 30 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours)  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion.
Sentencing hearing on August 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Chad W Myers in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 3.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 1, 2 and 4 dismissed and read-in. Defense requests another date for sentencing approximately 30 days. Court grants request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Chad W Myers in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises his client is not present and requests to have this matter set for plea/sentencing at 8:15 tomorrow morning. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Chad W Myers in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises this matter is in a jury posture for Tuesday. Case continued as set. This trial will take one day. Witness list to be filed by Monday. This matter will be called at 8:15 on Tuesday - 07/14/2015.

Defendant Chad W Myers in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a jury status/jury trial date. Court grants request.  Attorney has standing order regarding motions, jury instructions and witnesses.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chad W Myers in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another short date. Defense to advise on the next date how this matter will be scheduled.  Hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on May 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Chad W Myers in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense needs discovery and needs time to discuss this matter with his client. Defense requests another date . Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness  listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Defendant Chad W Myers in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
